perturbation.original_text: Developer will design, develop, and deliver, satisfactory to Client, the "Pelican Delivers Application Phase 1" (collectively, the Subject Program), and all elated Project services (collectively, the Services), Project work product (collectively, the Deliverables), and user manuals and other written material that describe he functionality or assist in the use of the Subject Program (collectively, the Documentation), pursuant to the Project specifications detailed in the SO (collectively, Specifications), as described in the enclosed statement of work (the SOW; as provided in APPENDIX A hereto). The Parties may execute multiple SOWs should there be multiple or separate Projects. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and any SOW, the terms of this Agreement will control.
perturbation.changed_text: Software Provider will design, develop, and deliver, satisfactory to Customer, the "Pelican Delivers Application Phase 1" (collectively, the Subject Program), and all elated Project services (collectively, the Services), Project work product (collectively, the Deliverables), and user manuals and other written material that describe he functionality or assist in the use of the Subject Program (collectively, the Documentation), pursuant to the Project specifications detailed in the SO (collectively, Specifications), as described in the enclosed statement of work (the SOW; as provided in APPENDIX A hereto). The Parties may execute multiple SOWs should there be multiple or separate Projects. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and any SOW, the terms of this Agreement will control.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Developer' and 'Client' are replaced with 'Software Provider' and 'Customer' respectively. While it may seem that the terms refer to the same entities throughout the contract, this creates ambiguity and could be interpreted differently, especially if a separate entity were to be involved. It is left to interpretation whether these are the same entities in other sections of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Client shall provide Developer assistance to complete the Services, and produce the Deliverables, as reasonably requested, including but not limited to providing the necessary information or documentation required from Developer for the development of the Subject Program. Client shall conduct all Acceptance Tests in good faith and shall not delay any acceptance of any Service or Deliverable without reasonable justification. The evaluation of any Service or Deliverable for any Acceptance Test will be based on material compliance with applicable Specifications and Client shall not arbitrarily withhold acceptance of any Milestone Deliverable or Subject Program.
perturbation.changed_text: Customer shall provide Contractor assistance to complete the Services, and produce the Project Outputs, as reasonably requested, including but not limited to providing the necessary information or documentation required from Contractor for the development of the Subject Program. Customer shall conduct all Acceptance Tests in good faith and shall not delay any acceptance of any Service or Project Output without reasonable justification. The evaluation of any Service or Project Output for any Acceptance Test will be based on material compliance with applicable Specifications and Customer shall not arbitrarily withhold acceptance of any Milestone Deliverable or Subject Program.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Client', 'Developer', and 'Deliverables' are replaced with 'Customer', 'Contractor', and 'Project Outputs' respectively. While the intention may be that they refer to the same entities, ambiguity is introduced and could be used to argue that the obligations differ, particularly if a dispute arises over the quality of the work.

perturbation.original_text: If Developer completes the Services, and delivers the Deliverables, as reasonably accepted by Client, upon a date prior to the Final Delivery Date as specific in a SOW hereto, Client will pay Developer a bonus Fee in the amount detailed in the applicable SOW (the Bonus).
perturbation.changed_text: If Contractor completes the Services, and delivers the Project Deliverables, as reasonably accepted by Customer, upon a date prior to the Final Delivery Date as specific in a SOW hereto, Client will pay Developer a bonus Fee in the amount detailed in the applicable SOW (the Bonus).
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Developer', 'Deliverables', and 'Client' are replaced with 'Contractor', 'Project Deliverables', and 'Customer' respectively. It then states the 'Client will pay Developer a bonus Fee'. This creates ambiguity and confusion as it introduces the new term 'Customer' with specific obligations, as well as potentially binding the original 'Client' and 'Developer' to the original agreement.
